column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

There were approximately 2700 export and 340 young cattle penned representing an increase of 700 head week-on-week. The usual buying group was present and operating in a dearer market in places. Quality declined with fewer prime lots, less finish in the trade and a larger proportion of cows. Finished trade cattle eased on some sales with quality an issue while medium weight feeder cattle sold up to 30c/kg dearer. Grown steers to feed gained 13c/kg while bullocks held firm. Heavy heifers eased slightly. Manufacturing steers lifted 5c to 8c/kg. Heavy beef cows sold firm while leaner grades eased 5c to 10c/kg and more on some sales. Heavy bulls lifted 10c/kg. 

Vealers sold from 280c to 394c/kg. Yearling trade steers made between 350c and 395c/kg. Yearling heifers to the trade sold between 310c and 358c/kg. Grown steers made from 340c to 392c/kg. Bullocks sold from 365c to 410c/kg. Heavy grown heifers made between 325c and 370c/kg. 

Most light and medium weight cows sold between 172c and 278c/kg. Heavy weight cows made mostly from 238c to 324c/kg. Heavy bulls sold from 285c to 364c/kg. 

Market reporter: Brendan Fletcher.
